results.name: Tintilla Vin Cotto
results.description: Nothing gose to waste here, when we hard press the white grapes prier to ferment we make Vin Cotto, an ancant Roma sweetener. Vin Cotto is an elixir made of Grape must, cooked with orange zest, cinnamon and nutmeg, it is sweeter and thicker than vinegar. It has subtle overtones of spice and the richness of concentrated grape juice. As a condiment small slurps are drizzled over roasts, and its versatility extends to dressing salads and fruits.

results.name: The Gordon Shiraz
results.description:
To be a 'Gordon' the Shiraz must be awarded a Gold Medal.

At its first Show, Australian Small Winemakers 2009, the 2008 Goron Shiraz was awarded Gold and The Dick De Luca Trophy for Best Queensland Shiraz. At its next  show, New England, it got just a bronze and the judges comments were of it being a little raw... fair enough as it had only just been bottled. We showed the wine at New Englnd the following year and it was awarded Gold.
results.tagline: Short description

results.name: The Gordon Shiraz
results.description:
Very low yield in 2012 so the wine had to perform well at New England or be condemned to be just a 'normal', un-named Estate Shiraz. The winning of a Gold and the Trophy, Best young Red of Show was agreed result but it actually got better as it also received the joint award of Best Wine of Show.

a medium bodied wine matured in two year old oak barrique. Without the 'top up' wine the wine would not have qualified for showing.
results.tagline: Gold and Trophy Estate Shiraz

results.name: Spritzanti Lizzie Semillon
results.description: The handpicked grapes undergo fermentation that is limited by chilling - this provides the wine with some residual natural sweetness. While chilled, carbon dioxide bubbles are captured in the wine. Totally unique in character, spritzie rather than bubbly - with a low alcohol of 9%. It is bottled early to capture the fresh fruit flavours and spritzie character.
results.foods: Served chilled, a great party wine, it is an ideal accompaniment to seafood and Asian or spicy foods.
results.tasting: Lemon, lime and peachy on the nose. good mouth feel with a touch of fruit sweetness, softness on the palate and a crisp spritzie zest

results.name: Tarantella Sangiovese Blend
results.description:
This multifaceted wine based on Sangiovese is aimed at reaching beyond the single varietal to produce a soft wine with a fresh mouth feel and lasting flavours. Adding to the complexity is a small amount of Shiraz, Cabernet and Merlot. All this gives a deep colour, rich berry flavour and mouth feel with soft tannins.

In fact the name Tarantella comes from a lively to be found in southern Italy, around Plugia known as the “Spider Dance” or dance of the Tarantula. The dance involves spinning and stomping of feet in a wild frenzy aimed at expelling the poison from the bite of a tarantula.
results.foods: Enjoy with roast red meats such as lamb with lentils
results.tasting: Fresh Fosrest Fruits on the nose. Rich berry flavours with soft tannins and a long elegant finish

results.name: James Cab/Merlot
results.description: Our Merlot block always seems to come through with the goods 2010 was a very good season. The Cabernet was Very good this year as well and blended the two to make a classic red. The handpicked grapes were triaged then fermented in open vats and racked to barrel, the pressings going to our press for gentle extraction. The wines were aged in new and old French oak for twelve months before blending. Traditional egg white fining was used prior to bottling.
results.foods: Roasted rack of lamb, oven roasted duck, wild forest mushrooms and marinated eggplant.
results.award_1: Trophy Winner 2013 Hunter Valley Boutique Wine Show
results.tasting: The aroma of this wine is dominated by fresh clean dark berry fruit, supported by subtle oak bouquet. On the palate you get blackcurrant, cabernet fruit and lingering tannins. Drink Now, and until 2022.

results.name: Justine Merlot
results.description: A nose showing plums and blackcurrants, violet and earthy complexities. The medium bodied, round in texture concentrated sweet varietal fruit flavour is matched with supportive spicy oak flavours and notes of cedar and sweet sweaty leather. This is a complex wine with refined mouth feel offering firm black/red currant fruit.
results.foods: Perfect to enjoy with red meat such as roast lamb, kangaroo and other game. But no one will look away in disgust if you care to savour it with a good white meat or platter of fish
results.tasting: The medium bodied, round in texture concentrated sweet varietal fruit flavour is matched with supportive spicy oak flavours and notes of cedar and sweet sweaty leather. This is a complex wine with refined mouth feel offering firm black/red currant and plum fruit.

results.name: Patriarch Syrah
results.description:
This wine is Tintilla’s flagship product and is fittingly made from Shiraz (alternatively called Syrah) a classic Hunter variety. Grown in red clay soil over limestone conglomerates, on a north east sloping hillside, Tintilla’s Shiraz vines enjoys ideal growing conditions.

To set this wine apart it is called ‘Patriarch’, symbolic of its hierarchal pedigree and used the traditional name Syrah as a mark of respect to the early Hunter pioneers who recognized its affinity with the Hunter soil and climate.
results.foods: Roast beef fillet with parsnip, spinach and mustard fruits
results.award_1: James Halliday 92 points
results.tasting: The aroma of this wine is vibrant, modern nose of strong, rich, black berry fruits in the Hunter savoury style with pepper and earth tones and added coconut from the oak maturation.The palate of this wine is powerful, yet elegant wine with tightly balanced tannins, concentrated and intense raspberry & blackberry fruit flavours with well integrated oak…and a certain ‘je ne sais quoi’. Smooth like a classic Hunter with great line and a long, briary and lasting finish. A great wine young, that will get more complex as it ages. Drink Now until 2030

results.name: Edwardo Fortified Semillon
results.description: An aperitif style of wine made by arresting the semillon ferment at a Beaume of 9 with pure alcohol. The wine is aged for six to twelve months in old oak and bottled as a vintage style. A complex wine best served chilled with a slice of lime. At 18% alcohol it is a great party starter.
results.foods: Serve chilled on ice with a twist of lime and your favourite fruit salad.
results.tasting: A strong, rich, fortified Semillon. This wine captures the fresh citrus, honey and toasty flavours of Semillon; it has a full bodied weight but finishes dry to maintain elegance.

results.name: Shortland Fortified Shiraz
results.description: From the earliest days of wine making in Australia there has been a tradition of fortifying wine with distilled grape spirit to produce a typically richer, sweeter, more robust and firm textured wine with higher alcohol. This type of wine with its high alcohol is stable and less likely to spoil; they travel well and can be enjoyed commonly after meals, as a desert wine or with cheese. Over many years they become richer and more complex either when bottled as a vintage style or aged in oak.
results.foods: with cheese
results.tasting: A full bodied palate of raspberry liquorice and Parma Violets. The spirit character is harmonious and integrated, and adds a refreshing lick of dryness to the finish.

results.name: Pineau Fortified Semillon
results.description: You will enjoy this aperitif style fortified Semillon, made in the Bordeaux tradition, particularly if you fancy a drop of Cognac. A blend of Cognac and white wine spirit is used to fortify the wine after allowing initial fermentation to about 9 beaume. This preserves the natural sweetness and flavour of the Semillon grapes. The wine is aged in French oak for one year and bottled as a vintage style. The Pineau Semillon is a lovely before dinner drink served chilled with a savoury finger food.
results.foods: It can also be enjoyed with desserts or cheese after dinner.

results.name: Vincento 10year barrel aged
results.description:
Liqueur fortified wines were the backbone of our early winemaking industry, having the ability to travel well and bring great pleasure to the consumer. Semillon, the great white grape of the Hunter, lends itself into making this liqueur wine, named after St. Vincent the patron saint of the wine grape grower.

Tintilla Estate has hand-crafted and barrel aged this liqueur Semillon, produced using the ancient solera system which ensures a component of 10 year old barrel aged wine in each bottle and adding much richness and complexity to the final wine.

 

The grapes were hand picked around 10-11 beaumé, the juice set aside to ferment in oak barrels being fortified with pure alcohol at a beaumé of 9 capturing the sweet essence and the acid backbone of the early picked Semillon.
results.foods: desert's and cheese
results.tasting: The extended barrel ageing has led to the development of a multilayered, complex wine. The darkened gold colour reflects the age and the viscosity in the glass the slow evaporation and concentration of flavours. Old Semillon develops rich toasty, honey, succulent characters all of which can be found in this wine as well as a luscious, unctuous broad mouth feel crying out “I am very special”

results.name: Maurice Fortified Cab Sav
results.description:
From the earliest days of wine making in Australia there has been a tradition of fortifying wine with distilled grape spirit to produce a typically richer, sweeter, more robust and firm textured wine with higher alcohol. This type of wine with its high alcohol is stable and less likely to spoil; they travel well and can be enjoyed commonly after meals, as a desert wine or with cheese. Over many years they become richer and more complex either when bottled as a vintage style or aged in oak.

 The concentrated flavours of our low yielding Cabernet Sauvignon are captured in the fortifying process with the addition of spirit at a beaume of approximately 9. The wine is aged in old 300l barrels, left on the lees for some months and racked and returned to the barrels. It is bottled as a vintage style at one year. 

We produce this wine only in exceptional years and being based on Cabernet Sauvignon grapes we expect it to be bottle aged for many years before drinking. However, even when young the dark ruby colours and fresh cabernet fruit flavours can be appreciated.
results.foods: with cheese's

results.name: Patina Reserve Chardonnay '09
results.description: Fermented and aged on its lees for 10 months in French oak, 25% new, 50% one year old and 25% two year old oak barrels.  The Reserve Chardonnay represents the best of the vintage with only the best barrels selected for this wine.  Alc/Vol 12.5%
results.award_1: Gold - 2015 Sydney International Wine Competition
results.tasting:
Rich varietal chardonnay aromas of peaches and cream, rock melon, cashews and creamy barrel aged lees characters. 

The palate is developed but fresh, smooth and well balanced with nothing obviously dominating the palate.  This wine is fine in texture with apricot, white stone fruit and crisp apple flavours balanced by a little creamy lees.  A multi-layered cool climate style that is generous yet elegant with excellent structure and length. 

Cellaring: This wine is drinking well now and I expect it become rounder and very scrumptious as it ages up to and possibly beyond 2021.

results.name: Patina Riesling '14
results.description: The grapes were hand picked with good acid levels just under 3 pH, crushed, skin soaked for a brief period and fermented cool in stainless vat to preserve its freshness.  The wine stopped fermenting naturally with 7 g/L residual sugar.  12.1% ALC/VOL
results.foods: Seafood, Chicken, Turkey, Pork
results.tasting:
Fruity, floral aroma with rose petal, pineapple, tropical fruit a very fragrant yet delicate wine.

The palate is very fresh fruity pallet with crisp mid palate and a long tapering finish with a hint of tea.

Cellaring: Although this wine is drinking well now with its fresh aromatic characters, you’ll be well rewarded if you put a few bottles away for several years. It will develop some luscious honey notes and complimentary flinty minerality over the next few years.  Expect this wine to continue to improve well beyond 2024.

results.name: Limette
results.description: Limette is a fortified white wine heavily infused with the juice and zest of Tahitian limes.
results.foods: Ice cream/water/white wine/meat marinade
results.tasting:
Boom. Boom. The magic of limes.

  • Limette is a wonderfully aromatic drink with a multitude of uses. It is a concentrate that can be used sparingly to wonderful effect.
  • Consume it straight in minute quantities with ice as you would a liqeur.
  • dilute50/50 with water and freeze it to be consumed as an iced cube.
  • Add a few drops to a white wine to radically improve its appeal.
  • Use Limette as an addition to marinades for meat to be barbecued or smoked.
  • Used as a cordial Limette dramatally improves the flavour of water.
  • Pour over vanilla ice cream and consume it slowly, relishing the moment.

results.name: Merlot
results.description: This is a medium to full bodied wine with great fruit depth. The wine displays an abundance of dark fruit, bitter chocolate and black jubes characters with hints of earth, game and mint. The tannins are noticeable yet soft and fine and the palate length impressive.
results.foods: Red and white meats, rice, pasta, biscuits and cheese, ice cream virtually anything.
results.tasting:
Dark red colour with a dark red hue.

Attractive aroma, displaying intense black jube, plum skin and slight minty note with attractive cedar oak.

Big rich intense wine. This is a merlot with depth and genuine fruit sweetness. Flavours are ripe and sweet with the black jubes character dominating over some toasty oak, plum and red fruit flavours. Tanins are evident and slightly powdery , but are soaked up by the intense fruit.

A merlot with fruit sweetness, structure and length –amazing !!

Customer Reviews:

 

This 2009 vintage Merlot is currently a favourite to enjoy with an evening meal. It is highly aromatic, has a big flavour across the mid palate and a zestful finish that immediately invites another mouthful. So, the bottle tends to disappear quickly, a reliable test of the worth of any wine, white or red. It's rare to see a Merlot with this degree of hedonistic pleasure attached to it. On my personal scale, if I had to point it, this would be a 97-99 and In have been making Merlots since 1984.  Merlot, like Pinot Noir has a high degree of difficulty attached to it (in the vineyard) and this wine comes through with flying colours.     The tendency is to pick it super ripe to avoid green flavours. This wine is ripe, without the green flavours. The flavour spectrum is deep and broad and no trace of hotness on the finish. It doesn't get much better than this regardless of grape variety. This example shows you that, on its day , Merlot can be up there with the best of them, perhaps to reign supreme, as with Petrus.        Erl Happ September 2014.

results.name: Petit Verdot
results.description: Mark Warren says:  A full bodied red wine with powerful chewy tannin structure. The palate has an abundance of red and dark berry fruit flavours with hints of cherry cola, liquorice and green plums. The wine has great length of flavour and finishes with sour cherries and chewy tannin...........Erl Happ says: Marks description sounds like medicine. But this is medicine for your soul. If you thought Cabernet Sauvignon the greatest of red grapes think again. Petit Verdot has an enormous reputation in Bordeaux, where they describe it as  SUPER Cabernet Sauvignon, but it rarely ripens there, and only in the warmest locations closest to the Atlantic. At Three Hills its the last grape to be picked, but its always ripe. It's the Bordeaux variety that escaped the Cabernet Franc parentage and genes, unlike Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot , Malbec and Cabernet Franc. This is a seriously engaging wine, eminently suitable for wooing.
results.foods: Light and heavy makes no difference, the wine is soft, savoury and long.
results.tasting:
Deep red colour with only the barest hint of brick red in the hue.

Attractive and lifted aroma of green plum, mulberry and violets with hints of menthol, choc mint and stewed rhubarb.

A full bodied red wine with a powerful chewy tannin structure. The palate has an abundance of red and dark berry fruit flavours with hints of cherry cola, liquorice and green plum. It has a great length of flavour and finishes with sour cherries and chewy tannin.

Customer Reviews:

 

  1. TanCH (Wednesday, 05 June 2013) Tried this wine first time at Must in MR and loved it so much went back to Happs Winery to buy more! Beautiful range of aromas and flavours with finely tannins that are surprisingly fine and integrated.
  2. Tomraven (Friday, 10 May 2013) We recently opened a bottle of Petit Verdot and a GSM. All I can say is they were both fantastic. Full bodied and smooth. I just wanted more.

results.name: Cabernet Franc
results.description: This is a wine with an impressive structure and depth of flavour. The wine displays aromas of ripe red berries, violets and a slight forest floor note. The flavours are concentrated, ripe and dominated by sweet berry fruit characters that soak up plenty of top quality French oak. The fine slightly chalky tannins give the wine texture and structure, yet they finish fine and long.
results.foods: Red and white meat, rice, pasta.
results.tasting:
Colour is deep red with a dark red hue

Lifted aroma of red fruit, mocha and violets with hints of blackberry and tomato leaf.

This is a wine with an impressive structure and depth of flavour. The wine displays aromas of ripe red berries, violets and a slight forest floor note. The flavours are concentrated, ripe and dominated by sweet berry fruit characters that soak up plenty of top quality French oak. The fine slightly chalky tannins give the wine texture and structure, yet they finish fine and long.

Customer Reviews:

 

  1. ellimo2793 (Tuesday, 07 February 2012) Last night my wife and I enjoyed a bottle of 2001 Cabernet Franc we purchased from the cellar door in 2006. It has been cellared in our wine fridge since that time and we were very excited to be able to enjoy such a distinctive wine. The colour was still vibrant purple, very clear with a small tinge of brick red. There was a hint of vanilla on the palate and the nose was still very robust. All in all the wine has held up well, with plenty of fruit still present. Most enjoyable and we look forward to buying more of this wine soon. I don't know if we will be able to wait as long to drink it though !!

results.name: Grenache Shiraz Mataro
results.description: Winemaker Mark Warren writes: Medium to full bodied with rich red fruits, cherry cola and forest floor flavours combining with hints of black olive and fresh herb. The palate is soft with fine grain tannin, a long slightly chalky finish and an intense cherry after-taste.............Erl Happ Writes:  Don't base your expectations on what you might expect to see in South Australia. This is Margaret River and the coolest end at that. The fruit is picked at the end of April and in a cool season into May. So, its elegant, silky, engrossing rather than a head banger from the Barossa.  Next release due mid to late 2015. That will be the Halliday 97 pointed 2012 vintage.
results.foods: Red meat
results.tasting:
Colour is red with a red/purple hue.

An attractive aroma of raspberry, cherry, truffle and red fruits with slight coffee, cracked pepper and eucalypt notes.

Medium to full bodied with rich red fruits, cherry cola and forest floor flavours combining with hints of black olive and fresh herb. The palate is soft with fine grain tannin, a long slightly chalky finish and an intense cherry aftertaste.

results.name: Pinot Noir
results.description: Aromatic, distinctly varietal, fully mature but fresh and engaging Pinot Noir, wood matured from an excellent vintage.
results.foods: Very versatile

results.name: Pinot Noir
results.description: A fruity aroma displaying strawberry, sour cherry, cranberry, vanilla bean and ripe rhubarb characters with some stalk and mushroom notes. The ripe strawberry and cranberry flavours carry on to the palate and combine with glace cherry, green plum with a hint of Ribena and plum. It's a light to medium bodied wine with good fruit intensity and lively acidity that is perfect for everyday drinking.
results.foods: Any meal, light medium or heavy
results.tasting:
Colour is light red with a red hue.

  A fruity aroma displaying strawberry, sour cherry, and cranberry with ripe rhubarb, spice and stalk characters.

  The ripe strawberry and cranberry flavours carry on to the palate and combine with fresh cherry, green plum and a hint of confection. It’s a light to medium bodied wine with good fruit intensity and soft tannin that is perfect for everyday drinking.

 

Customer Reviews:
  1. skessell@bigpond.net.au (Saturday, 05 January 2013) While no wine expert, I quite enjoy my wine. My somewhat modest cellar (about 60 dozen) is mostly Porongurup Rieslings, Great Southern Shiraz and Margaret River cab savs. A tiny corner is reserved for some extremely good (but sadly very $$) Aussie pinot noirs, from Tassie, Geelong, the Mornington Peninsula, the Yarra, and the Adelaide Hills. These are not everyday tipples, but maybe one bottle (or perhaps two) a month. So I am always on the lookout for GOOD, AFFORDABLE pinot, and am overjoyed that I found yours! With one or two others from the Mount Barker / Porongurup region, they are the only ones, for under $30, that are not only drinkable, but really quite enjoyable. And I do think yours is probably the best value for money of the lot. Thank you, and Well Done!
  2. Isabelle De casamajor (28th July 2014) My favourite is the "indigenous pinot noir" it is light but full of flavour. It can be drunk at ambient temperature or slightly chilled which suits spicy food very well.  It is a very easy wine which can be drunk as an aperitif as it does necessarily need food for you o appreciate its flavour.

Colour pale straw yellow

results.name: Cabernet Sauvignon
results.description: A medium to full bodied wine with concentrated fruit flavour and good structure. The flavours are of black currant, red currant, black jubes, and maraschino cherry with hints of black olive, stewed rhubarb and bitter chocolate. The palate is tight with good acidity and noticeable grainy tannin that combine to give the wine the classic drying structure one expects from this variety. A wine that will undoubtedly reward those who lay it down for a few years.
results.foods: Red meats, pasta and rice dishes
results.tasting:
Colour is Intense dark red with a red-violet hue

Dark fruit, black currant, black jubes, violets and cedar aromas with hints of green plum, rum, eucalypt and the tomato leaf character typical of this variety grown in this region.

A medium to full bodied wine with concentrated fruit flavour and good structure. The flavours are of black currant, red currant, black jubes, and maraschino cherry with hints of black olive and bitter chocolate. The palate is tight with good acidity and noticeable grainy tannin that combine to give the wine the classic drying structure one expects from this variety. A wine that will undoubtedly reward those who cellar.

results.name: Cabernet Merlot
results.description: It is a medium to full bodied wine with noticeable fine tannin and bright fruit. The flavours are predominantly dark fruit with hints of red fruit, dark chocolate, fruit pastels and eucalypt. The wine has a good tannin structure ideally suited to aging.

results.tasting:
Clour is a deep red with a red hue.

Lifted aroma of black currant, bay leaf, red fruit, and tomato leaf with some attractive oak char and notes of eucolypt note.

It is a medium to full bodied wine with noticeable challky tannin and bright fruit. The flavours are predominantly dark fruit with hints of red fruit, dark chocolate, fruit pastels and eucolypt. The wine demonstrates good persistence and a good tannin structure ideally suited to aging.

results.name: Merlot

Customer Reviews:

 

  1. ClayZ (Thursday, 22 August 2013) Back in 1999, I visited Happs and brought one of my very first bottles of wine (from a cellar door) and it was the 1999 Garnet. As it was special, I decided to keep it for a special occasion; unfortunately that didn't happen. In 2002, I moved to the UK and all my stuff was put into a storage locker in Mandurah, including the Garnet and there it sat for 5 years. I returned un packed it and I thought, NO, there's still a special occasion coming, and i left it unopened. Then finally last year, my dearest friend got engaged and her husband to be and her love ports and sweet dessert wines, so I thought, why not open it now and share it with them. No words can adequately describe how smooth and delicious this wine had become. So sweet and sticky, smooth and intense, we savoured it for hours. All 3 of us agreeing it was one of the most delicious wines we hadever drunk. Just loved it and it made the occasion so special and truly worth waiting the 13 years to open it. I return regularly to Happs and always buy big, I ABSOLUTELY ADORE ALL YOUR WINES. But I have always grabbed another bottle of Garnet and I am cellaring two at the moment for a good 10-15 year stint to relive the joy of the wine. My Absolute favourite of your wines though is your Tintanello - but that’s another story for another time. Thank Happs for all the joy you have brought me.
  2. kirsty (Friday, 18 February 2011) I absolutely love HAPPS Garnet. I love to share it with other friends who love fortified wine too. Winter Dozen

results.name: Inception Shiraz
results.description:
Origin of Name

When we introduced the Progeny Shiraz and D’Orsa shiraz to our range, it was always our intention to add a “stage” name to the “Estate” shiraz however it has taken some time to agree on that perfect name.

So from the 2012 vintage, the “Estate” Shiraz will be called “Inception” meaning the beginning of something or the establishment or starting point of our family business. A very fitting name considering the Estate shiraz is our flagship wine.

Coinciding with a stage name change, we will also be changing the bottle shape of the Estate. It will become a burgundy style.
results.award_1: 96/100 James Halliday 2015 Australian Wine Companion
results.award_2: Silver Medal (51.5 points) Dan Murphy’s National Wine Show 2013
results.award_3: Gold Medal (93 points) Wine Showcase Magazine
results.tasting:
This wine distils the essence of our Heathcote terroir, letting the vine suck the goodness from ancient, red soils and get its delicious fruit into the bottle with the minimum of stress. It was the driest winter and spring in our memory, restricting vine development and forcing it to squeeze all its flavour into a small crop, ending with great vintage conditions. Splash some into a glass alongside a dish of lamb shanks to discover the layered ripe flavours, black fruit aromas and robust structure - a winter wonderland.
(Notes were written at time of Release)

results.name: Sanguine Estate Tempranillo 2013
results.award_1: TROPHY and Gold Medal 2014 Heathcote Wine Show

results.name: Sanguine Estate Rose 2014
results.tasting:
Australian summers usually provide idyllic weather, perfect for al fresco lunches with friends under a shady tree. Mediterranean nations have known for centuries that the friendliest ‘vin d’été’ is a chilled rosé. The 2013 rose was crafted from early harvested shiraz grape juice, bled to barrel before too much colour was extracted from the red skins. The hot summer helped to produce a very rich and smooth rose with intriguing aromas how pot puree and red apple the palate is fruity with crunchy acid to give it a vibrant finish.
(Notes were written at time of Release)

results.description: Created from a unique tapestry of 'terroir', the Barossa Tower Cabernet Merlot shows lifted aromas of black cherry, blackcurrant and plum accompanied by dark chocolate and dark berry fruits on the palate. The finish is long with fine-grained tannins from eighteen months maturation in both new and seasoned oak barrels.
results.foods: Spiced venison with wild mushroom and truffle sauce.
results.tagline: This blend is sourced from five of our loyal growers with vineyards in the Barossa-sub regions of Bethany, Krondorf and Tanunda.
results.award_1: GOLD Medal - Berlin Wine Trophy 2014
results.tasting:
Approachable and easy drinking yet displaying the same character that can be found in our premium wines. Barossa Tower is an accessible and diverse range including some hand-picked and basket pressed parcels of fruit. These wines are lightly filtered, high quality, with rich fruit flavours in an easy drinking style. 

The grapes were destalked (separating berries from the bunch) and places uncrushed into small stainless steel open fermenters. A cultured yeast was used to start the fermentation and the tanks were hand plunged spending 7 days on skins at 28 degrees celsius. The skins were gently pressed in the JLB Vaslin Bucher press and the wine spent 18 months in French oak hogsheads.

This range will stand nobly against any of the good ranges of wine in the world. The wines are complex, delicious and rich with true individual character.

results.name: Craig's pinot noir
results.tagline: Outstanding pinot

results.name: 2012 Museum Pinot Noir
results.tagline: Club Only
results.tasting:
There are indeed some wonderful pinot noir vineyards in the Adelaide Hills. This wine is made from 

a lovely vineyard near Charleston, sloping gently to the east to catch the morning sun. Perfect!

Like our terrific 2010 Pinot, this one was given long barrel aging – 22 months – in order to make sure 

the soft tannins were well rounded, and so that all the flavours were developed and well-integrated. Lots of 

barrel time does not mean lots of oak aroma and flavour as the barrels were well matured, having been used 3 

or 4 times before. Using older barrels gives all the advantages of barrel aging without smothering delicate 

wines with oak.

Appearance: Medium-light, vibrant and with very attractive ruby red tints. 

Nose: Lifted perfume, leading to deeper black cherry aromas and some subtle oak spice.

Palate: Cherry and pinot strawberry characters follow through to the palate. Flavours are clean and clear. A round full middle palate with very supportive soft tannins. 

Potential: Beautiful drinking now and will get better and better over the next 5 or so years, and age gracefully after that.

results.name: 2012 Picnic Races Tempranillo
results.tagline: Lifted, savoury, elegant, European style
results.tasting:
The philosophy of our Picnic Races Red is for it to be a supple mature wine with plenty of time in barrel, not 

to be too big and rich, and to be interesting. And we’ve always said it won’t necessarily be from the same grape 

variety. Well this one certainly isn’t. We’ve gone from the quintessentially French Bordeau varieties, 

Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc to the wonderful Spanish Rioja variety – Tempranillo.

I’ve felt for a while that our Australian versions of wines from this variety have been nice, but didn’t have the 

complexity that comes from long aging in barrel – and this is what I love in a red. The wines of Rioja have it, 

with a stylish savoury dryness and great length. So that’s where I’m heading with our Tempranillo.

The 2012 vintage was ideal, with great colour and flavours, just about everywhere in SA, and very notably in 

McLaren Vale. The fruit was harvested ripe, but with the grapes not being too high in sugar so that the 

resulting alcohol was quite modest – ca 13.5%.

Like our previous Picnic Races Reds, the wine was matured in well-used barrels (between 4-6 years old), so 

that we got the benefit of the wine being in them but without picking up massive amounts of oak aroma and 

flavor. It stayed in barrel until June this year – about 26 months in all!

And typical of Tempranillo, the young wines had great structure, with high soft tannins that made it so 

worthwhile giving them plenty of barrel time.

Colour: Deep without being black – bright and vibrant in the glass.

Nose: There’s an immediate savoury lift to the nose that I think is very European (if I’m allowed to say that!!). There are hints of blackberry and other dark fruits.

Palate: Flavoursome and complex, with medium body and elegant rather than rich. There’s the blackberry, a slight earthiness and a hint of marzipan, a very subtle touch of oak and some really nice lingering spice. Savoury all through. The soft tannins carry the flavours all the way.

Potential: Bottled in August 2014, the wine is settling down and may need a bit more time to really round out fully, but I’m very happy drinking it now! It will cellar very well, improving for at least 4-5 years, and going on nicely well after that.

results.name: 2012 Sparkling Pinot Noir
results.description:
Dry, making for a wonderful, sophisticated aperitif

Made in the methode champenoise, from 100% Pinot Noir.

Tiny, elegant bead.

Crushed strawberry aromas with a complex creaminess on the palate.
results.tasting:
Designed as a particularly dry, sophisticated aperitif wine.

The base this sparkling was made from 100% Adelaide Hills pinot noir.

Grapes were picked in Summertown, from the 2nd highest vineyard in South Australia. 

This sparkling is for drinking now or in up to five or 10 years; being 100% pinot noir, the ageing 

process will see the wine remain pale and elegant, and slightly honeyed. 

Closed under crown seal rather than cork, with the specific intention of retaining the persistent bead 

should the bottle be opened 10 years from now. 

Appearance: Pale, untouched by pinot skins, with an elegant, very fine and persistent bead.

Nose: Tantalising aromas, suggesting yeast and crushed strawberries, rise readily from the glass.

 

Palate: The flavour is delicate, reflecting the aromas. It is elegant and dry while still retaining softness. The fresh finish is enhanced by the lingering effect of the bubbles. A wine that showcases the potential of Adelaide Hills sparklings.

results.name: Four Winds Vineyard Tom's Block Shiraz

results.name: The Chateau '100 Year Old Vines' Grenache 2012
results.description: This wine displays lifted floral perfume characters. On the palate red berry flavours of strawberry and cherry compliment tones of earthy spice flavours and leave a soft, rich and velvety finish.
results.foods: Lamb and cheese dishes
results.tagline: The grapes for this wine are from Wayne Ahrens' single vineyard from the Vine Vale sub-region. The low-yielding 'Centenarian' vines were planted more than a century ago around the time construction of The Chateau itself began.
results.award_1: 93 Points - James Halliday , Australian Wine Companion 2015
results.award_3: BAROSSA GRENACHE TROPHY - International Wine Challenge 2014
results.tasting: The Barossa is home to some of the oldest vines in the world. Our Centenarians are a truly unique opportunity to experience wines made from vines aged between 100 and 165 years old. With power and fortitude these vines stand, having survived drought, frost and heat. These wines are only produced in minute quantities due to the scarcity of such ancient vines.
results.winemaking: The hand-picked grapes were destemmed, but not crushed, and spent seven days on their skins in an open fermenter with twice daily hand-plunging and pump over of the cap to gently extract colour, flavour and tannins. This was followed by careful basket pressing and malolactic fermetation in a combination of new and seasoned French oak barrels prior to eighteen months' maturation in our cellars. In keeping with our non-interventionist winemaking style we have neither fined nor filtered this wine and as a result a pure deposit may form. Decanting is recommended.

results.name: Barossa Tower Shiraz Primitivo 2012
results.description: Shiraz gives lifted aromas of blackberry, plum and black pepper with spicy, dark berry fruits on the palate has benefited from the addition of Primitivo, native to southern Italy, adding vibrant cranberry, raspberry and strawberry flavours. The finish is long with fine grained tannins from eighteen months maturation in both new and seasoned American and French oak barrels.
results.foods: Thai style dishes, tomato based pasta dishes and cheese
results.cellar_until: Drinking well now and up to 5 Years from vintage.
results.tagline: Shiraz & Primitivo combine to deliver a wine of great structure, robust flavours and finesse.
results.award_1: GOLD Medal - AWC Vienna International Wine Challenge 2013
results.tasting: Approachable and easy drinking yet displaying the same character that can be found in our premium wines. Barossa Tower is an accessible and diverse range including some hand-picked and basket pressed parcels of fruit. These wines are lightly filtered, high quality, with rich fruit flavours in an easy drinking style.
results.winemaking: This unique blend is sourced from our growers’ vineyards in the Barossa sub-regions of Bethany, Kalimna (bush vine Primitivo), and Moppa.It is this tapestry of ‘terroirs’ which enables us to create our house style of Barossa Shiraz Primitivo.

results.award_1: Barossa Valley Wine of the Year 2014 - China Wine & Spirits Award 2014
results.tasting: The Barossa is home to some of the oldest vines in the world. Our Centenarians are a truly unique opportunity to experience wines made from vines aged between 100 and 165 years old. With power and fortitude these vines stand, having survived drought, frost and heat. These wines are only produced in minute quantities due to the scarcity of such ancient vines.
results.winemaking: Made from the grapes of vines that are over 100 years old. Hand-picked, basket-pressed and unfiltered, the gentle unobtrusive winemaking has captured the subtle and intriguing characters of these centenarian Shiraz vines. The grapes were destalked and placed uncrushed into small stainless steel open fermenters. A cultured yeast was used to start the fermentation and the tanks were hand plunged spending 15 days on skins at 28° C. Further maturation in a combination of American and French oak hogsheads and barriques for 22 months has resulted in a wine of great structure and finesse.

results.name: Terroirs of the Barossa' Lyndoch Shiraz 2012
results.description: From a vineyard in the southern end of the Barossa, this 2012 Shiraz is full of soft, dark cherry fruit with rich kirsch like notes, dark chocolate and spicy oak. The palate is textured and layered, with the dark berry fruit aromas again coming to the fore. The palate has a long finish, complimented by defining oak tannins.
results.foods: To showcase the wine it is best served with one cheese or chargrilled beef
results.tagline: This is the definitive "Barossa Shiraz" big, strong and bold - with classic Shiraz characters typical of lower yielding hard clay soils and exposed sites from Lyndoch and the Semmler vineyard.
results.award_1: 95 Points - James Halliday , Australian Wine Companion 2015
results.award_2: 92 Points - Gary Walsh , The Wine Front
results.award_4: GOLD Medal - China Wine & Spirits Award 2014
results.tasting: Discover the differences between Ebenezer: elegance and structure; Greenock: richness; Lyndoch: strength and boldness. Wines from three distinct sub-regions yet made identically. A journey through the Terroirs is a lesson in the Barossa's versatility. These wines are made in limited quantities.
results.winemaking: The grapes were destalked (separating berries from the bunch) and placed uncrushed into small stainless steel open fermenters. A cultured yeast was used to start the fermentation and the tanks were hand plunged spending 7 days on skins at 28° C. Further maturation in a mixture of French and American Oak for 18 months has resulted in a wine of great structure and finesse.

results.name: Terroirs of the Barossa' Greenock Shiraz 2012
results.description: The dark, brooding regional characters of plum, red cherry and liquorice are all to the fore of this wine. The palate is focused and linear, with dark bitter chocolate notes and an elegant long persistent finish. We recommend cellaring for 10 years.
results.foods: To showcase the wine it is best served with one cheese or chargrilled beef
results.tagline: A magnificent rich and ripe tasting Barossan shiraz.

results.award_2: DOUBLE GOLD Medal - China Wine & Spirits Award 2014

results.name: Terroirs of the Barossa' Ebenezer District Shiraz 2012
results.description: Ebenezer is located in the Northern most reaches of the Barossa and wines from this region are typically characterised by lifted aromas of lavender and spice. The palate is full of red fruits, leather, cedar and fine, talc like tannins.
results.foods: To showcase the wine it is best served with one cheese or chargrilled beef
results.tagline: This elegant and structured wine is made from grapes of the 80 year old vines at the Lowke family vineyard at Ebenezer.

results.award_2: GOLD Medal - China Wine & Spirits Award 2014

A journey through the Terroirs is a lesson in the Barossa's versatility. These wines are made in limited quantities.

results.name: The Whole Dam Family 2013
results.description: This is a medium bodied wine with aromas of strawberries, cherries and subtle spice. The palate is well balanced and highlights lifted flavours of vanilla, cinnamon, black olives and pepper. A vibrant and fresh wine with a long soft finish.
results.foods: Game or slowly braised meats.
results.cellar_until: Drink now or cellar to enhance complexity.
results.tagline: Celebrates the historic relationship between Chateau Tanunda, the Barossa and its generations of grape growers and winemakers who love nothing more than to let their hair down and kick up their heels.
results.award_1: SILVER Medal - International Wine Challenge 2014
results.award_2: 91 Points - James Halliday , Australian Wine Companion 2015
results.tasting: The Whole Dam Family; celebrates the historic relationship between Chateau Tanunda, the Barossa and its generations of grape growers and winemakers who love nothing more than to let their hair down and kick up their heels. Once you see the photograph on the label you will understand what we mean! The wine is a blend of the Whole Dam Family of meridional French varieties: Shiraz, Grenache, Mourvèdre, Carignan and Cinsault.
results.winemaking: The Whole Dam Family celebrates the historic relationship between Chateau Tanunda, the Barossa Valley and its generations of grape growers and winemakers who love nothing more than to let their hair down and kick up their heels. For this limited release wine we selected The Whole Dam Family of meridional French varieties: Shiraz (41%) from Stonewell, Grenache (24%) from Tanunda, Mouvedre (22%) from Bethany and Greenock, Carignan (7%) and Cinsault (6%) from Vine Vale. The grapes were picked, fermented and matured separately spending nine months in a combination of new and seasoned American and French oak barrels.

results.name: The Chateau Bethanian Shiraz 2013
results.description: Lifted aromas of blackberry, blueberry and black pepper supported by spicy, dark berry fruits on the palate. The extensive finish is framed by elegant, fine-grained from eighteen months’ maturation in a combination of new and seasoned American and French oak barriques and hogsheads.
results.foods: Braised ox tail stew in red wine or a spicy stock.
results.tagline: The Chateau Bethanian Shiraz is from the single vineyard of Bethany which was originally planted in 1960.
results.tasting: Chateau Tanunda is known as ‘The Chateau' in the Barossa and is said out of respect for its hundred-year-old history. The Château range is a more accessible premium range of single vineyard wines. These wines are from mature vines and made with exceptional care. This range will stand nobly against any of the good ranges of wine in the world. The wines are complex, delicious and rich with true individual character.
results.winemaking: The two blocks were picked separately and the grapes were destemmed, but not crushed, and spent seven days on their skins in open fermenters to gently extract colour, flavours and tannins. Regular pump overs and rack and returns prior to gentle basket pressing have made a full-bodied wine.

results.name: Grand Barossa Cabernet Sauvignon 2012
results.description: Rich blackcurrant, blackberry and plum with notes of vanilla and chocolate lead to a lingering finish framed by fine-grained tannins from 18 months maturation in French and American oak.
results.foods: Herb crusted lamb with red wine jus.
results.tagline: This medium to full bodied wine is a generous and elegant Cabernet Sauvignon and has a delightful lingering finish.
results.award_1: DOUBLE GOLD Medal - China Wine & Spirits Award 2014
results.award_2: 90 Points - Gary Walsh , The Wine Front
results.award_4: SILVER Medal - International Wine & Spirit Competition 2014
results.tasting: Grand Barossa represents the epitome of Barossa's classic red and white varieties. A grand label showing the influence of our European origins and drawing from the grandeur of the Chateau and our wines. The wines are rich and have delicious intensity and subtlety with an Australian/European wine making style.
results.winemaking: The grapes were destalked (separating berries from the bunch) and placed uncrushed into small stainless steel open fermenters. A cultured yeast was used to start the fermentation and the tanks were hand plunged spending 7 days on skins at 26° C. The skins were gently pressed in the JLB Vaslin Bucher press and all of the parcels were matured for 16 months in a mixture of new and older French oak.

results.name: The Chateau Botrytis Semillon 2011
results.description: The luscious and rich Botrytis Semillon has a complex bouquet of marmalade and orange peel with a hint of apricot and toasted hazlenut. The palate builds on the intense aromas and flavours and is enhanced by the long lingering finish with a refreshing acidity. This wine is the perfect accompaniment to fresh fruit desserts, blue cheeses and pates.
results.foods: Classic cheesecake with orange rind marmalade
results.tagline: This luscious aged botrytis wine has a complex bouquet of orange and marmalade, with overtones of hazelnuts and apricots.
results.tasting: Chateau Tanunda is known as ‘The Chateau' in the Barossa and is said out of respect for its hundred-year-old history. The Château range is a more accessible premium range of single vineyard wines. These wines are from mature vines and made with exceptional care. This range will stand nobly against any of the good ranges of wine in the world. The wines are complex, delicious and rich with true individual character.
results.winemaking: Handpicked bunches of ‘Botrytis' affected grapes were carefully selected having achieved optimum sugar ripeness for this style of wine. A long cool fermentation averaging 16°C preserved the luscious fruit flavours. After fermentation the wine was racked, filtered and bottled soon after to retain its flavour intensity.

results.name: The Chateau Blanc de Blancs 2012
results.description: Bursting with aromas and flavours of green apple, lemon and citrus fruits combined with a hint of toast, lemon curd, nougat and spice with a crisp, clean finish.
results.foods: An ideal aperitif and sensational with seafood, especially freshly shucked oysters.
results.cellar_until: Either drink fresh and young or cellar to enhance complexity.
results.tagline: This is a wine elegant in structure with crisp acidity and a creamy lingering finish which exhibits refreshing, zesty citrus flavours and vibrant floral aromas. It is ideal for celebration!
results.award_1: SILVER Medal - Champagne & Sparkling Wine World Championships 2014
results.award_3: SILVER Medal - International Wine & Spirit Competition 2014
results.tasting: Celebrate with Chateau Tanunda's exceptional sparkling range and bring a touch of glamour and elegance to any special occasion. With a focus on outstanding fruit quality and depth of character, our sparkling wines represent remarkable value for money rivalling their more expensive European counterparts.
results.winemaking: The grapes come from the estate vineyard on Matthews Road, high in the Eden Valley at more that 400m above sea level, carefully picked in the cool of the night to retain the grapes’ fresh citrus fruit flavours and natural acidity which is vital in sparkling winemaking. Following a gentle pressing of the grapes the free-run juice undergoes primary fermentation on light lees. (Malolactic fermentation is discouraged in order to retain the wine’s freshness and vivacity.) The base wine is then bottled prior to its secondary fermentation with eighteen months’ maturation on yeast lees.

results.name: The Chateau Cabernet Sauvignon 2013
results.description: ‘The Chateau’ Cabernet Sauvignon displays deep, rich purple and red hues. The bouquet has lifted aromas of blackcurrant, redcurrant and spice on the velvety smooth palate with hints of cedar and mint. It crafts an extensive finish, framed by elegant, fine-grained tannins from two years’ maturation in a combination of new and seasoned French oak barrels.
results.foods: Beef bourguignon or other slow-braised meat dishes.
results.tagline: The grapes for this year's Chateau Cabernet Sauvignon were grown on the sandy loam soils of block 16 in our Bethany vineyard which was first planted in 1960.
results.tasting: Chateau Tanunda is known as ‘The Chateau' in the Barossa and is said out of respect for its hundred-year-old history. The Château range is a more accessible premium range of single vineyard wines. These wines are from mature vines and made with exceptional care. This range will stand nobly against any of the good ranges of wine in the world. The wines are complex, delicious and rich with true individual character.
results.winemaking: The grapes for this year’s The Chateau Cabernet Sauvignon were grown on the sandy loam soils of blocks 12 and 16 of our Bethany vineyard which was first planted in 1960. The grapes were destemmed, but not crushed, and spent seven days on their skins in open fermenters with twice daily hand-plunging and pumping over of the cap to more gently extract colour, flavours and tannins. This was followed by careful basket pressing and malolactic fermentation in a combination of new and seasoned French oak barrels prior to eighteen months’ maturation in our cellars.

results.name: Barossa Tower Pinot Grigio 2014
results.description: This wine is a cool climate example from Eden Valley where the clean natural acidity has been naturally preserved to give the wine a delicacy and freshness typical of some northern Italian Pinot Grigio’s. A beautiful bright wine with aromas of green apple, nashi pear and a hint of spice on the nose and a restrained palate of zesty citrus and stone fruit flavours with a touch of minerality on the finish.
results.foods: Light seafood dishes, shellfish and salad.
results.cellar_until: Drinking well now and up to 5 Years from vintage.
results.tagline: Produced from hand picked grapes from a high altitude, single vineyard.
results.tasting: Approachable and easy drinking yet displaying the same character that can be found in our premium wines. Barossa Tower is an accessible and diverse range including some hand-picked and basket pressed parcels of fruit. These wines are lightly filtered, high quality, with rich fruit flavours in an easy drinking style.
results.winemaking: Picked early in the morning, the fruit was delivered cool to the winery. Gentle pressing to minimise phenolics and cold settling preceded a long, cool fermentation averaging 14°C. The fermentation was left to run its course over 14 days leaving a naturally clean, crisp vibrant wine.

results.name: Barossa Tower Moscato 2013
results.description: This light, fresh and deliciously sweet wine is the perfect aperitif. The nose is characterised by the lifted floral notes of musk and engages the palate with a natural fruit sweetness. The slight effervescence is refreshing and cleansing with fruit notes of lime and pineapple.
results.foods: A perfect aperitif or with fresh-fruit based desserts.
results.tagline: This light, fresh and deliciously sweet wine is the perfect aperitif for balmy evenings.
results.tasting: Approachable and easy drinking yet displaying the same character that can be found in our premium wines. Barossa Tower is an accessible and diverse range including some hand-picked and basket pressed parcels of fruit. These wines are lightly filtered, high quality, with rich fruit flavours in an easy drinking style.
results.winemaking: Picked early in the morning, the fruit was delivered cool to the winery. Free run juice and cold settling preceded a long, cool fermentation. The fermentation was left to run its course over 14 days leaving a naturally sweet, vibrant wine. A touch of spritz is detectable on the palate from the residual carbon dioxide which was harnesses and bottles to retain both fruit vibrancy and freshness.  The Tower is the grand entrance to The Chateau and the Barossa Tower range is your gateway to a contemporary selection of wines for everyday drinking, from both classic and new varieties, highlighting the Barossa’s rich diversity.

results.name: Barossa Tower Shiraz 2012
results.description: Lifted aromas of blackberry, plum and black pepper accompanied by spicy, dark berry fruits on the palate. The finish is long with fine-grained tannins  from  maturation  in both new and seasoned American and French oak barrels. Although drinking well now this wine may be cellared for up to five years from vintage.
results.foods: Beef ragu and barbecued meats
results.cellar_until: Drinking well now and up to 5 Years from vintage.
results.tagline: The Barossa Tower Shiraz has rich, ripe blackberry and plum flavours. It is fresh and luscious with plenty of upfront flavour and persistence.
results.award_1: SILVER Medal - Sydney Royal Wine Show 2014
results.tasting: Approachable and easy drinking yet displaying the same character that can be found in our premium wines. Barossa Tower is an accessible and diverse range including some hand-picked and basket pressed parcels of fruit. These wines are lightly filtered, high quality, with rich fruit flavours in an easy drinking style.
results.winemaking: The grapes were traditionally fermented with cultured yeasts, in a combination of open and static fermenters. Pumping over and plunging techniques were used to extract the rich, soft tannins and vibrant colour from the skins. The wine was matured in a combination of French and American oak barrels for up to 15 months prior to blending. This wine is sourced from the Cricket and top Blocks of our estate vineyard in Tanunda, plus from a rich tapestry of other growers across the sub-regions of the Barossa.

results.name: Three Graces Cabernet Sauvignon Cabernet Franc Merlot 2011
results.description: A classic lifted nose of blackcurrant cassis and cedar wood with hints of black olive, pepper, violets and tobacco. The palate is an integrated blend of flavours, svelte and seamless showing prominent blackcurrant fruit delicately interwoven with tobacco leaf, capsicum, black pepper and savoury French oak giving the wine an undeniable elegance and generous length.
results.foods: Italian braised pork, osso buco or a roast sirloin of beef.
results.cellar_until: Drinking well now or cellar for 5 -8 years.
results.tagline: The Three Graces is a classic Bordeaux blend of three of the worlds most noble varieties.
results.award_1: GOLD Medal - China Wine & Spirits Awards 2013
results.award_2: SILVER Outstanding - International Wine & Spirit Competition 2013
results.tasting: The Three Graces represent the union of some of the world's noblest grape varieties: Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot and Marsanne, Viognier and Roussanne. The wines are beautifully blended to display intensely aromatic fruit flavours. In Greek mythology ‘The Three Graces' exemplify beauty, charm and joy.
results.winemaking: The grapes for the Three Graces are selected from premium vineyards in the Barossa and Eden Valleys including the Krondorf, Lyndoch, Stonewell and Vine Vale sub-regions. Delivered in small bins the grapes were destemmed (separating berries from the stalks) and placed into stainless steel open fermenters. A cultured yeast was used to start the fermentation and the tanks were pumped over daily spending a total of 7 days on skins at 22 - 28° C. The skins were gently pressed in the JLB Vaslin Bucher press and the individual parcels were matured separately for three months before being racked, blended and undergoing a further 20 months in a mixture of French oak hogsheads & puncheons.

results.name: The Chateau Old Bush Vine Grenache Rose 2014
results.description: Delightful pale pink in colour, this dry rosé takes its inspiration from the Provençale rosés of Southern France where subtle fruit flavours and mouth-watering refreshing acidity are sought to complement the local cuisine. A truly elegant wine.
results.foods: Prawn linguini ina butter sauce with a hint of chilli.
results.cellar_until: Drink fresh and young as an aperitif.
results.tagline: A single vineyard block - 80 year old, dry grown bush vines situated on the sandy soils of the Ebenezer sub-region.
results.tasting: Chateau Tanunda is known as ‘The Chateau' in the Barossa and is said out of respect for its hundred-year-old history. The Château range is a more accessible premium range of single vineyard wines. These wines are from mature vines and made with exceptional care. This range will stand nobly against any of the good ranges of wine in the world. The wines are complex, delicious and rich with true individual character.
results.winemaking: The Chateau Old Vine Grenache Rosé is made from grapes grown by the Hamilton family in their Fuller’s vineyard which was planted more than 100 years ago on the sandy loam over deep limestone soils of the Barossa’s Penrice sub-region.  After just twelve hours’ skin contact, the free-run juice was fermented at low temperature for three weeks in old French oak hogsheads resulting in a complex wine of depth and texture without any oak character or flavour.

results.name: The Chateau Eden Valley Riesling 2012
results.description: This unique single vineyard wine displays all the delicacy, elegance and finesse that can be achieved from this most noble variety. The nose shows lifted aromas of lime blossom and citrus fruits, while the palate has great intensity and length with mouth-watering acidity.  Excellent natural acidity along with an intense aromatic fruit profile.
results.foods: Asian dishes and fresh seafood.
results.tagline: This unique single vineyard wine shows all the delicacy, elegance and finesse that can be achieved from this most noble variety.
results.award_1: 5 STARS - Andrew Graham , Australian Wine Review
results.award_2: SILVER Medal  - Royal Adelaide Wine Show 2013
results.award_3: SILVER Outstanding  - International Wine & Spirit Competition 2013
results.tasting: Chateau Tanunda is known as 'The Chateau' in the Barossa and is said out of respect for its hundred-year-old history. The Château range is a more accessible premium range of single vineyard wines. These wines are from mature vines and made with exceptional care. This range will stand nobly against any of the good ranges of wine in the world. The wines are complex, delicious and rich with true individual character.
results.winemaking: Handpicked early in the morning. Gentle pressing, minimizes phenolics and cold settling precedes fermentation, capturing the delicacy, elegance and finesse of this noble variety. The wine is bottled immediately to retain freshness and vivacity. 40% of this wine comes from old vines planted in the 1920s.

results.name: Barossa Tower Semillon/Sauvignon Blanc 2012
results.description: The grassy, zesty character of the Semillon blends harmoniously with the ripe tropical fruit notes of the Sauvignon Blanc, making this the ideal aperitif wine or the perfect accompaniment to seafood, shellfish and salad dishes. This wine is crisp fresh and dry.
results.foods: Pear and walnut salad, grilled mackerel and Thai fish cakes with chilli & coriander.
results.cellar_until: Drinking well now and up to 5 Years from vintage.
results.tagline: A crisp, classic dry white style from the Barossa and Adelaide Hills.
results.award_1: GOLD Medal - China Wine & Spirits Awards 2013
results.tasting: Approachable and easy drinking yet displaying the same character that can be found in our premium wines. Barossa Tower is an accessible and diverse range including some hand-picked and basket pressed parcels of fruit. These wines are lightly filtered, high quality, with rich fruit flavours in an easy drinking style. This year’s Semillon/ Sauvignon Blanc was sourced from a single vineyard of old vine Barossa Semillon, from the Liersch vineyard in Bethany and the Sauvignon Blanc from a small selection of vineyards in the Adelaide Hills.
results.winemaking: Picked early in the morning, the fruit was delivered cool to the winery. Gentle pressing to minimise phenolics and cold settling preceded a long, cool fermentation averaging 14°C. The fermentation was left to run its course over 14 days leaving a naturally clean, crisp vibrant wine.

results.name: Old Cooperage Cabernet Malbec 2011
results.description: This synergistic duo seamlessly combines the elegance, power and structure only achievable in a blended wine. Lifted aromas of blackberry, blueberry and black pepper supported byspicy, dark berry fruits on the palate with a long elegant finish.
results.foods: Rich meat stews or other game dishes
results.tagline: The original Chateau Tanunda Cooperage was responsible for hand crafting the most important component of wine maturation - the Barrel.
results.award_1: 94 Points - James Halliday , Australian Wine Companion 2015
results.award_2: 94 Points - James Halliday , Australian Wine Companion 2014
results.tasting: The Old Cooperage; celebrates the historic relationship between Chateau Tanunda and A.P. John Coopers. The John family began operating as coopers in 1889 when Christian Paul John established the Chateau Tanunda Cooperage. The wines for this blend which will change from vintage to vintage are aged in A.P. John oak barrels.
results.winemaking: All of the grapes were fermented separately at the winery in small 3 tonne fermenters. The grapes were destalked (separating berries from the bunch) and placed uncrushed into small stainless steel open fermenters. A cultured yeast was used to start the fermentation and the tanks were hand plunged spending 7 days on skins at 28° C. Further maturation in a mixture of AP John French and American oak for 18 months has resulted in a wine of great structure and finesse.

results.name: Barossa Tower Shiraz Primitivo 2011
results.description: Approachable and easy drinking yet displaying the same character that can be found in our premium wines. Barossa Tower is an accessible and diverse range including some hand-picked and basket pressed parcels of fruit. These wines are lightly filtered, high quality, with rich fruit flavours in an easy drinking style.
results.foods: Seared kangaroo fillet.
results.cellar_until: Drinking well now and up to 5 Years from vintage.
results.tagline: Shiraz & Primitivo combine to deliver a wine of great structure, robust flavours and finesse.
results.tasting: Shiraz gives lifted aromas of blackberry, plum and black pepper with spicy, dark berry fruits on the palate has benefited from the addition of Primitivo, native to southern Italy, adding vibrant cranberry, raspberry and strawberry flavours. The finish is long with fine grained tannins from eighteen months maturation in both new and seasoned American and French oak barrels.
results.winemaking: This unique blend is sourced from our growers’ vineyards in the Barossa sub-regions of Bethany, Kalimna (bush vine Primitivo), and Moppa.It is this tapestry of ‘terroirs’ which enables us to create our house style of Barossa Shiraz Primitivo.

results.name: Three Graces Marsanne, Viognier, Roussanne 2012
results.description: This synergistic trio seamlessly combines the beauty, charm and joy only achievable in a three-way blend where the Marsanne brings elegance and texture, the Viognier finesse and flavour and the Roussanne grace and structure.
results.foods: Asian dishes or swordfish
results.cellar_until: Drinking well now or cellar to enhance complexity.
results.tagline: With The Three Graces Marsanne Viognier Roussanne I have been able to bring to life my passions: art, cricket and winemaking.
results.award_1: TROPHY Best Dry White Blend - Royal Adelaide Wine Show 2013
results.award_2: 90 Points - James Halliday , Australian Wine Companion 2014
results.award_3: 90+ Points - Gary Walsh, The Wine Front
results.tasting: The Three Graces represent the union of some of the world's noblest grape varieties: Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot and Marsanne, Viognier and Roussanne. The wines are beautifully blended to display intensely aromatic fruit flavours. In Greek mythology ‘The Three Graces' exemplify beauty, charm and joy.
results.winemaking: The Three Graces also represent three of the noblest white grape varieties: Marsanne, Viognier and Roussanne. The grapes were picked early to retain their freshness and fermented separately in stainless steel vats with a small portion of each variety both barrel and wild fermented followed by nine months' maturation on lees.   With The Three Graces Marsanne Viognier Roussanne I have been able to bring to life my passions: art, cricket and winemaking. With a nod to the works of Canova and Raphael this wine is dedicated to W.G. Grace, "The Champion", who had two brothers, E.M. and G.F., who also played cricket for England, including one test together against Australia in 1880.

results.name: Heritage Label Old Vine Shiraz 2011
results.description: The resulting Shiraz is full of soft, dark cherry fruit with rich notes of dark chocolate and subtle oak. The palate is textured and layered, with the dark berry fruit aromas again coming to the fore. The palate has a long plush, elegant finish.
results.foods: Roast beef with pepper sauce
results.tagline: 3 Blocks of low yielding Old Vine Shiraz were specially chosen for this unique blend. All of the blocks were planted in 1960 and so the vines are over 50 years old.
results.award_1: 93 Points - James Halliday , Australian Wine Companion 2014
results.tasting: Old Vine Barossa Shiraz; which in the Barossa means at least 35 year old vines, and is decked out in a reprise of an early Chateau Tanunda Limited label.
results.winemaking: All of the grapes were fermented separately at the winery in small 3 tonne fermenters. The grapes were destalked (separating berries from the bunch) and placed uncrushed into small stainless steel open fermenters. A cultured yeast was used to start the fermentation and the tanks were hand plunged spending 7 days on skins at 28° C. Further maturation in a mixture of French and American oak for 18 months has resulted in a wine of great structure and finesse.

results.name: The Chateau '100 Year Old Vines' Semillon 2013 *Wine Club  Exclusive Pre-Release*
results.description: Enhanced aroma and structure whilst building delicious citrus fruit flavours with complexity, depth and length. Crisp grapefruit flavours that develop into a long citrus and mineral finish.
results.foods: Sashimi or a light goats cheese salad
results.cellar_until: Either drink fresh and young or cellar to enhance complexity.
results.tagline: Hand picked on Valentines Day, these grapes come from the renowned Vine Vale sub-region from low yielding vines more than 120 years old.
results.award_1: 92 Points - Lisa Perrotti-Brown MW
results.award_2: SILVER Medal - China Wine & Spirits Awards 2013
results.tasting: The Barossa is home to some of the oldest vines in the world. Our Centenarians are a truly unique opportunity to experience wines made from vines aged between 100 and 165 years old. With power and fortitude these vines stand, having survived drought, frost and heat. These wines are only produced in minute quantities due to the scarcity of such ancient vines.
results.winemaking: Hand picked, these grapes come from the renowned Vine Vale sub-region from low yielding vines more than 120 years old.

results.name: The Chateau Old Vine Semillon 2012
results.description: Aromas of citrus and lemon barley with a hint of vanilla from partial wild yeast and barrel fermentation and maturation. The palate is delicate, yet intense, bringing crisp grapefruit flavours and concluding in a long, citrus and mineral finish.
results.foods: Crispy skin salmon with mildly spiced Asian greens.
results.cellar_until: Either drink fresh and young or cellar for 3 to 5 years to enhance complexity
results.tagline: Many priceless old vine Semillon vineyards are under threat in the Barossa, however in making this wine we have preserved an important part of the Barossa's heritage.
results.award_1: 91 Points & Special Value - James Halliday, Australian Wine Companion 2014
results.award_2: 90 Points - Gary Walsh, The Wine Front
results.award_3: 91 Points & Special Value - James Halliday, Australian Wine Companion 2015
results.tasting: Chateau Tanunda is known as ‘The Chateau' in the Barossa and is said out of respect for its hundred-year-old history. The Château range is a more accessible premium range of single vineyard wines. These wines are from mature vines and made with exceptional care. This range will stand nobly against any of the good ranges of wine in the world. The wines are complex, delicious and rich with true individual character.
results.winemaking: Picked early in the morning, the fruit was delivered cool to the winery. Gentle pressing to minimise phenolics and cold settling preceded a long, cool fermentation averaging 14°C. A small portion (5%) of the Semillon was fermented in new French oak using a wild yeast to give added complexity and structure to the wine.

results.name: The Everest - Old Bushvine Grenache 2009
results.description: Dense purple colour, the nose displays notes of blueberry, kirsch, marzipan and an intense licorice spice. The wine is incredibly dense and multi - layered yet still retains an elegance and softness as well as a textural purity that few wines can achieve. Supple tannins from the gentle press merely complement the fruit, silky and rich yet impressively interwoven into the wine. The fruit/acid balance ensures excellent length and provides a purity of structure for long term ageing.
results.foods: Best enjoyed on its own or with one cheese.
results.tagline: The wine is an exotic mixture of herbs, Asian spices, dried fruits and berry flavours all coming together in a complex and lingering experience.
results.award_1: 96 Points - James Halliday , Australian Wine Companion 2013 Edition
results.tasting: ‘The Everest' is our premium range and is the pinnacle of Chateau Tanunda's wine making philosophy. "Every person has their own Everest to climb," - these wines are our best. Handpicked, basket pressed and unfiltered, the wines are given the best possible treatment and represents the ultimate the Barossa Valley can achieve. The Everest are not made every year. Only very limited cases are released if the vintage fulfills the expectation of this brand.
results.winemaking: Fermented in French oak puncheons, hand plunged 3 times daily. Completed MLF in oak and then matured for 24 months in oak, matured on lees to maintain structure and fruit profile, minimal SO2

results.name:
Terroirs of the Barossa' Ebenezer District Shiraz 2010
*Museum Release*
results.description: Ebenezer is located in the Northern most reaches of the Barossa and wines from this region are typically characterised by lifted aromas of lavender and spice. The palate is full of ripe blackberry and blueberry fruits with hints of chocolate, pepper and vanilla. The finish is long and complex with fine-grained tannins developed from maturation in new & seasoned French and American oak.
results.foods: To showcase the wine it is best served with one cheese or chargrilled beef
results.tagline: This elegant and structured wine is made from grapes of the 80 year old vines at the Lowke family vineyard at Ebenezer.
results.award_1: 95 Points - James Halliday , Australian Wine Companion 2013 Edition
results.tasting: Discover the differences between Ebenezer: elegance and structure; Greenock: richness; Lyndoch: strength and boldness. Wines from three distinct sub-regions yet made identically. A journey through the Terroirs is a lesson in the Barossa's versatility. These wines are made in limited quantities.
results.winemaking: The grapes were destalked (separating berries from the bunch) and placed uncrushed into small stainless steel open fermenters. A cultured yeast was used to start the fermentation and the tanks were hand plunged spending 7 days on skins at 28° C. Further maturation in a mixture of French and American Oak for 18 months has resulted in a wine of great structure and finesse.

results.description: Dense ruby colour, with an intense, enticing nose of rich, red berry fruits and subtle French oak. The wine is incredibly dense and focussed with a richness and purity that simply exudes top class Barossa Shiraz. Rich dark chocolate, mocha and cedar spice are all to the fore but the central core is highly focussed.Supple tannins from the gentle press merely complement the fruit, silky and rich yet impressively interwoven into the wine.The fruit/ acid balance ensures excellent length and provides a purity of structure for long term ageing.
results.foods: Best enjoyed on its own or with one cheese.
results.tagline: The wine is rich with amazing generosity of flavour coupled with a tight backbone structure.
results.award_1: 95 Points  - Huon Hooke , Gourmet Traveller WINE
results.award_3: "Superb Follow Up" - Kerry Skinner , Illawarra Mercury

Handpicked, basket pressed and unfiltered, the wines are given the best possible treatment and represents the ultimate the Barossa Valley can achieve. The Everest are not made every year. results.winemaking: Fermented in open fermenters over 9 day period, daily hand plunging & pump overs. Only the highest quality, drainings run off to complete MLF in oak and then matured for 24 months in French oak, matured on lees to maintain structure and fruit profile.

results.name: Nightwatch Sparkling Chardonnay Pinot Noir NV
results.description: A lifted delicate nose with fresh, lemon zest from the Chardonnay and strawberries and cream from the Pinot Noir. The palate is fruit driven and fresh, with added layers of cream and softness from malolactic fermentation and time on tirage lees.
results.foods: Rock oysters with salt water vinaigrette or prawns in a butter herb sauce.
results.cellar_until: Either drink fresh and young or cellar to enhance complexity.
results.tagline: A beautfiul example of the decadence of sparkling Chardonnay & Pinot Noir
results.tasting: Celebrate with Chateau Tanunda's exceptional sparkling range and bring a touch of glamour and elegance to any special occasion. With a focus on outstanding fruit quality and depth of character, our sparkling wines represent remarkable value for money rivalling their more expensive European counterparts.
results.winemaking: Fruit is picked at night to ensure cooler temperatures and retain fruit aromatics. On arrival at the winery the fruit is gently crushed and pressed to minimise phenolics and maximise fruit flavour and delicacy. All wines undergo 100% malolactic fermentation and remain on lees until required for blending and stabilising. The final base wine components are then bottle fermented and spend a short period on tirage lees providing further yeast complexity in the final wine. Individual base wine components are then carefully selected for the final blend just prior to bottling.

results.name: Nightwatch Sparkling Shiraz NV
results.description: The nose is elegant and lively with lovely, rich aromas of blackberry, dark cherry fruit and spice. The wine is vibrant and balanced with a soft, creamy, palate of strawberry and red cherry fruit flavours. The finish is fresh and lively with great length.
results.foods: Duck breast or rare roast beef salad.
results.cellar_until: Either drink fresh and young or cellar to enhance complexity.
results.tagline: This is a black, intense, dark and broody example of Barossan sparkling shiraz at it's best.
results.award_1: SILVER Medal - Cowra Wine Show 2009
results.award_3: 88 Points - James Halliday , Australian Wine Companion 2013 Edition
results.tasting: Celebrate with Chateau Tanunda's exceptional sparkling range and bring a touch of glamour and elegance to any special occasion. With a focus on outstanding fruit quality and depth of character, our sparkling wines represent remarkable value for money rivalling their more expensive European counterparts.
results.winemaking: This bottle fermented Shiraz is created from a blend of vintage wines and the individual parcels of Shiraz undergo primary fermentation in stainless steel vats followed by extended barrel fermentation on lees in order to build complexity and richness. The base wines are then blended and bottled adding the liqueur de tirage for the secondary fermentation which gives the wine its sparkle. After eighteen moths’ bottle maturation on lees the wine is disgorged and topped up with the liqueur de dosage which counterbalances the wine’s natural acidity.
