results.name: Red Edge Mataro 2009
results.description: I usually blend mataro with some of my other wines. I bottled three barrels of the 2009 vintage because I really liked the unique varietal characteristics. 14.3% alcohol and aged for 2 years in French oak barriques
results.tagline: This is the first edition of a straight Mataro (also known as Mouverdre) from Red Edge.
results.tasting:
Colour: Dark red with magenta edges.

Bouquet: Plummy with earthy and spicey nuances

Palate: Medium weight front palate and an earthy, savoury finish.

results.name: Red Edge Cabernet 2009
results.description: The challenge was to  nurture the parcel which arrived at the presses. It showed fully ripe blackcurrant fruit flavour, adequate natural acidity, and balanced firm tannins . 25% of the grapes were included as whole-bunches with the balance crushed and destemmed  into pot fermenters. Indigenous yeast fermentation proceeded to dryness before pressing after 10 days on skins, directly into new and older barrels for 2 years maturation..
results.tagline: A project wine  crafted from  hand picked, non-irrigated vines yielding only thee tonnes .
results.tasting:
Colour: Dark rich red

Bouquet: Bursting with cassis/black berry fruit, licorice and slightly minty notes, cedary oak background.

 

Palate: Full bodied with sweet up-front fruit richness. Ripe fine tannins that linger and finish with dry savoury flavours.

results.name: Red Edge Tempranillo Monastrell 2009
results.description: This 50/50 blend of the Spanish Tempranillo and Mourvedre, or Monastrell, is an unusual combination in historical terms, but one that works. The varieties are near each end of the ripening spectrum, the Tempranillo being our first variety to ripen, and Mourvedre one of the last along with Cabernet. Each variety is picked, fermented and matured separately before blending prior to bottling. The deeper darker fruit and firmer tannin backbone of Mourvedre is a perfect foil for the spicy vibrant Tempranillo. The combination results in a round, savoury, utterly food driven wine.
results.tagline: Cellaring: Shorter to medium term, very approachable now, but should develop further suppleness with up to 5 years aging
results.tasting:
Colour: Medium hue brick red

Bouquet: Red berry fruit with savoury spicy edge, some charcuterie nuances – a combination of the spice of Tempranillo and the plummy Mourvedre.

 

Palate: Soft and round with savoury flavours of mocca and game dominant over the core of plummy fruit sweetness, moderate tannins.

results.name: 2011 Four Winds Vineyard Cabernet Merlot
results.description: This blend was made in the old world style of balanced winemaking.   We fermented each variety separately at cool temperatures and basket pressed the wine at the end of fermentation to gently extract tannins and flavours.  The balance of Merlot to the Cabernet was made to create a wine that was smooth with gentle rich tannins.  We wanted to express the unique Murrumbateman terroir with a balance of fruit, oak, tannins and acid.
results.foods: Lamb roasts
results.tagline: A nice medium bodied Cabernet Merlot
results.tasting: Approximately 8% Merlot has been blended with Cabernet Sauvignon in order to complete the palate profile of the wine.  Both wines were aged for approximately eighteen months in French oak and have an attractive degree of maturity without being overborne by oak flavours.  The fruitiness of the Cabernet is allowed to achieve prominence.  This is a well structured wine with well developed full flavours of dark cherry with hints of chocolate and dark berries.  It has excellent persistence of flavour.  It will team well with red meat, particularly roasts, but will also be a pleasing companion to strong cheeses with crusty bread.  Drinking particularly well at the moment, but will cellar for up to five years.

results.name: 2011 Four Winds Vineyard Merlot
results.description: Produced in the old world style of balanced wine making.  We want the wine to express the Murrumbateman terroir with good balance of fruit, French oak, structural tannins and medium alcohol.
results.tagline: An easy drinking lighter style of Merlot
results.tasting: This is an easy drinking Merlot showing true varietal and terroir characteristics.  This wine has spicy brooding berry aromas.  Vibrant ripe red berry and cherry are supported by the spice and cedar wood flavours gained from aging with French oak wood.  It has depth and a broad texture.  The wine is approachable in its youth and will continue to gain complexity with age.

results.name: OUT OF STOCK Patina Chardonnay Little Wood '10
results.description:
Lifted cool climate varietal chardonnay aromas of stone fruit, citrus, apple and melon complemented by the nutty oak maturation aromas.

This wine displays apple and melon characters complemented with lightly nutty oak. It’s fine and understated with a refreshingly balanced palate.
results.cellar_until: Expect this wine to broaden out and become quite delectable over the next five years.

results.name: Patina Sauvignon Blanc '14
results.description: The finish to the season was wet and difficult scattering botrytis throughout but the flavours in the vineyard were amazing.  We selectively handpicked and hand sorted over the sorting table removing almost all the damaged fruit.  The grapes were then destemmed/crushed and after a period of skin contact the must was pressed and the bulk of the wine was fermented at cool temperatures in stainless steel tank with a small portion fermented in seasoned French oak.
results.foods: shellfish, tomato gazpacho, young goats'cheese, salads, seafood
results.tasting:
Elegant aromas of passionfruit, lychee and tropical fruit are apparent up front but the nose is quite complex and more flavours develop as you continue to smell the wine. 

The enticing palate is very mouth filling and surprisingly long for a Sauvignon Blanc, the palate continues to develop for several minutes after the wine is gone.

Cellaring:I suspect this wine will age reasonably well as a portion of it was made in oak but it is drinking so well now that I don’t recommend cellaring it.  Rather I recommend you buy a couple cartons to share with friends before it runs out and then wait to see if I do as good a job with the 2015.

results.name: Patina Scandalous Riesling '14
results.description: The grapes were picked with good acid levels and fermented cool in stainless vat until the natural grape sugar and acid struck an enticing balance.  The vat was then moved into the freezer room to stop the fermentation and retain 18 g/L of residual sugar.
results.foods: An outstanding wine for spicy foods like Thai.
results.tasting:
Fruity and floral aromas of rose petal, pear and citrus a very fragrant yet delicate wine.

The enticing juicy fruit up front palate interplays with light minerality leading to lemon/apple sorbet mid palate and a refreshing lime finish. A very fruity wine with a good balance between up front sweetness and tangy citrus finish.

Cellaring: I made this wine to show off the fresh young fruitiness of Riesling from Orange so I recommend it be consumed young.  However I am looking forward to tasting this wine when it is 5-10 years old as I suspect it will evolve from fresh and fruity to become quite luscious and citrusy.

results.name: OUT OF STOCK - Patina Cabernet Sauvignon '05
results.description: Tantalizing aromas of ripe fruit balance with the more developed complexities of barrel ageing. The palates is mouth filling yet elegant with up front ripe fruit flavours leading to a dryer mid-late palate finishing with  mature tannins and hints of tobacco, chocolate and caramel.  This is a true expression of an aged Cabernet, displaying the fruit, intense palette and mouth filling tannin that makes this variety so desirable.
results.cellar_until: Although drinking well now expect this wine to drink well for at least ten years.

results.name: Patina Chardonnay '09
results.description:
This wine is the result of a combination of barrel ferment, aged on lees for 10 months and tank fermented, aged on lees for 7 months.  35% new oak, 30% old oak, 35% Tank 

 

12.5% AL/VOL
results.tasting:
Lifted varietal chardonnay aromas of apple and melon complemented by the complex, nutty oak maturation aromas.

The palate shows complex lees influence from fermentation and time in barrel, while apple and melon characters mix easily with lightly nutty oak. It’s fine and understated with a refreshingly balanced palate.

Cellaring: Orange Chardonnay generally complexes and improves quite dramatically during the first few years of bottle ageing.  This style is intended to be enjoyed young but it should age well at least through 2017.

results.name: Patina Reserve Chardonnay '08
results.description: Lifted varietal chardonnay aromas of apple and melon complemented by the complex, nutty oak maturation aromas. This wine shows complex lees influence from fermentation and time in barrel, while apple and melon characters mix easily with lightly nutty oak. It’s fine and understated with a refreshingly balanced palate.
results.cellar_until: It is drinking well now and I expect it become rounder and very scrumptious as it ages up to and possibly beyond 2020.
results.award_1: Winestate Magazine, May/June 2014: 5 STARS
results.award_2: Gilbert Labour, The Grape Hunter, May 2014
results.tasting:
Varietal chardonnay aromas of white stone fruit and rock melon with hints of vanilla, cashews and creamy barrel aged lees characters.

The dry palate is fine in texture with white stone fruit and rock melon leading to a bit of juicy grapefruit mid palate and following on to flavours of nuts and creamy lees from barrel maturation. A multi-layered cool climate style that is generous yet elegant with excellent structure and length.

results.name: 2014 Patina Winter Dozen
results.description:
Welcome to the 2014 Winter Club Dozen.  I’m having fun with this dozen as I decided to dust off a few museum pieces and reward Club members with a vertical taste of my Cabernet Sauvignon. 

There are six vintages included in this Special Club Release.  The first Cabernet harvested at Patina was 2002 so all except the 2001 are from Patina’s vineyard.  This is a great chance to see how the vineyard, the wine and the Winemaker have evolved over time.

 

The 2014 whites included in this Club dozen have had some extended skin contact resulting in great mouth feel and flavour intensity.  I think these two wines are delicious so I’m letting Club Members be the first to taste them.

results.name: NV Patina Old Tawny Liqueur
results.description: My Tawny wine is made up of several varieties of grapes, including Muscat, Cabernet Sauvignon, Shiraz and even a little bit of Semillon. It is an average age of 13 years old and displays luscious notes of nuts, toffee and contentment.
results.cellar_until: It is at is peak now, and will stay that way for a number of years.
results.award_1: Winestate Magazine, May/June 2014: 4.5 STARS

results.name: Patina Scandalous Riesling '13
results.description: Fragrant floral, passion fruit, pineapple, tropical fruit, pear and citrus. The enticing juicy fruit up front interplays with a light minerality leading to lemon-lime sorbet mid palate and a refreshing citrus finish.  A very fruity wine with a good balance between up front sweetness and a tangy citrus finish.
results.cellar_until: I recommend it be consumed young

results.name: OUT OF STOCK Patina Sauvignon Blanc '13
results.description: Out of stock
results.tasting:
Refreshing nuances of lychee, gooseberry, pineapple, lime and grapefruit.

Fresh up front fruit flavours combine with citrus and lychee mid palate leading to an unexpectedly long grapefruit/lime sorbet finish.

results.name: Patina Riesling '13
results.description: Generous ripe fruit up front, lemon curd / lemon pith mid palate and a long clean citrusy finish.
results.foods: Goes well with appetisers, entrées and lighter mains such as seafood, poultry, and pork.
results.cellar_until: Expect this wine to continue to improve well beyond 2023.

results.award_2: Gilbert Labour, The Grape Hunter, May 2014
results.tasting:
Elegant, lightly floral, tropical fruit and lemony citrus.

Generous ripe fruit up front, lemon curd / lemon pith mid palate and a long clean citrusy finish.

results.name: NV Patina Rosé
results.description:
This Non-Vintage Rose' is one of a kind from two vintages.  It began life back in 2008 when I co-fermented Pinot Noir and Chardonnay as a sparkling base.  This wine would have made great bubbles but I just couldn’t get my heart into it.  So in 2013 I decided to change direction and added it to the juice of 2013 Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc to re-ferment and make it into a non-vintage rose’.  The result is an absolutely delightful wine and a beautiful sunset is simply incomplete without it.

Composed of 21% Pinot Noir, 21% Chardonnay from 2008 Sparkling base wine that was picked quite young.  38% Merlot 14% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6%  Cabernet Franc from 2013.  The Pinot Noir was crushed directly into the press with minimal skin contact and the Chardonnay was whole bunch pressed.  The 2013 juice was all run-off with very minimal skin contact.  After clarifying it was fermented at cool temperature until the ferment stopped naturally with 7 g/L unfermented sugar remaining.   13% ALC/VOL
results.tasting:
An inviting aroma of fresh picked, ripe strawberry, peach, honey dew interwoven with floral hints.  A very compelling rose'.

The palete has very enticing fresh fruit flavours framed by a very refreshing palate.  Although the wine is dry the fresh ripe fruit is very apparent up front with a dry medium to long finish.

Cellaring:  Don’t cellar this wine.  It is simply too delightful now so why try to change it with age.

results.name: Patina Sticky Tea Riesling '11
results.description: The birth of the Sticky Tea happy accident: Basket presses are desirable in winemaking because they are gentle on the fruit and don’t extract many bitter phenolics. The drawback is the skins are tipped out while still quiet wet. Since Riesling is notoriously stingy with its juice it always annoys me to tip out the Riesling pressings knowing there is still up to 25% juice left. So in 2009 I added yeast to the pressed skins not sure what would result. Tea leaf, honey and lemon notes dominated after a few days of ferment so I decided this could make a very interesting sticky/aperitif style with a bit of an iced tea slant.
results.foods: An absolute delight with Chicken Liver Parfait or Fois Gras.
results.award_1: James Halliday, Australian Wine Companion 2013: 90 Points
results.tasting:
Intense aromas of apple, pear, lemon, green tea and jasmine tea are so attractive in this wine that you probably won’t even wash the glass when it’s empty in hope that it may fill the house and live forever.

The sweet early palate is fresh and fruity carrying through to a mid palate of mouth watering lemony apple/pear sorbet and a clean jasmine/green tea finish – a great aperitif/light desert style wine

Cellaring:  The 2009 vintage is aging very well and I will continue tasting as the wine ages though at this stage I don’t recommend cellaring the 2011 as it is so delectable now.

results.name: Patina Pinot Noir '10
results.description: This wine was matured for three years in aged French oak barrels to add structure to the palate and enhance the savoury characters.  12% ALC/VOL
results.foods: An excellent accompaniment to duck, pork and pasta.
results.tasting:
This Orange Pinot Noir displays sour cherry, savoury and spice aromas with hints of cedar and dusty oak.

 

The palate is very varietal, with sour cherry interlaced with savoury notes leading to spice and cedary oak mid palate and finishing with fine, yet firm tannins.

Cellaring:  This wine is drinking well now but expect it to soften over the next few years.

results.name: OUT OF STOCK Patina Chardonnay Un-wooded
results.description:
Lifted varietal chardonnay aromas of sweet, ripe fruit, peach and honey dew melon are complimented by the creamy lees aromas.

Soft up front peaking with a strong mid palate and a long fine taper- ing finish with very appealing texture, fruit and lees characteristics.
results.cellar_until: It is intended to be enjoyed young but you can age it to 2017 as it should evolve to show more roundness and leesy characters.
results.tasting:
Inviting flinty notes mingle with hints of stone fruit, honey dew melon and tropical fruit complimented by creamy lees aromas.

Very refreshing with nuances of pineapple leading to peach mid palate with a long fine tapering finish of appealing texture, citrus and lees characters.

results.name: OUT OF STOCK  'Winemaker's Select' Pinot Noir '08
results.description: Orange Pinot Noir is very delicate and can be easily dominated by winemaking practices. This wine was matured for two years in three year old French oak in order to add character and structure to the palate with minor oak flavour.
results.foods: It’s an excellent accompaniment to chicken, lamb, pork and pasta.
results.cellar_until: This wine is drinking well now and should continue to show favourable development for many more years.
results.tasting:
This fragrant Pinot Noir displays varietal aromas of earth, spice, and ripe red fruits.

 

The palate is very varietal, with cherry and black currant leading to a plump mid palate and finishing with silky tannins.

results.name: Patina 'Jezza' Cabernet Merlot '08
results.description:
The grapes were crushed then cold soaked to extract dark berry flavours before being fermented in vat. It was pressed off skins during late ferment and aged in new and old French oak along with one new American barrel - just to add a little interest.

Cabernet Sauvignon gives the wine nuances of black currant flavours with good up front palate intensity and a lingering soft tannin finish. Merlot rounds out the mid palate and contributes rich berry flavours while the Cabernet Franc contributes a lightly lifted floral note, sweet spice and intensity to the mid palate.
results.foods: A wide range of red meat, white meat and casserols.
results.award_1: Winestate Magazine, May/June 2014: 5 STARS
results.tasting:
This wine displays rich aromas of ripe plum, blackberry, black currant, dark cherry, chocolate and well integrated toasty oak.

The palate is mouth filling yet elegant with up front ripe berry, dark cherry and plum flavours. It is a well structured wine with subtle integrated oak, firm tannins, and a long back palate

Cellaring: This wine has the intensity of fruit and tannin along with freshness that will enable it to age very well. It is drinking well now but if you can put it away for three to five years it will develop enticing secondary characters and the tannins should become silky and simply irresistible.

results.name: Patina Cabernet Merlot '07
results.description: After crushing the must was cold soaked then pressed off skins during late ferment and aged for 12 months in a combination of both new and old French and American oak barrels.
results.foods: Perfect with lamb roast and most other red and white meats.
results.tasting:
Leafy black currant aromas integrate with cedary oak and inviting maturation characters.

An inviting up front palate of black currant and cherry fruit flavours leading to a long peppery back palate with hints of chocolate and firm tannins. 

Cellaring:This wine is drinking well now, and will continue to develop complementary aged characters well through 2020.  It is an excellent compliment to lamb Roast.

results.name: Patina Merlot '06
results.description:
Merlot is a variety that does particularly well in Orange.

Picked with ripe black berry and mulberry characters it was then cold soaked after crushing to extract the rich berry flavours.  Pressed off skins at about ten percent alcohol to minimize seed tannin extraction, it was then aged in seasoned French oak for 12 months.
results.tasting:
Tantalising aromas of dark berry fruit, liquorice and green olive balance with lovely developed complexities of barrel aging in mature oak. 

This wine is intense with liveliness not normally associated with Merlot. Flavours of dark fruit and liquorice lead into a well constructed palate framed with fine tannins.

Cellaring:  This wine has been released with bottle age that has softened the tannins and is drinking well now and should continue to show favourable development through 2018.

results.name: Patina Cabernet Sauvignon '06
results.description:
Cabernet Sauvignon is a variety I am quite excited about for Orange, our high altitude and intense sunlight seems to concentrate its flavours.

Picked with ripe black currant and blackberry characters it had seven days cold soak after crushing to extract the rich blackberry flavours.  Pressed off skins when all sugar was fermented and then aged primarily in French oak for 12 months.
results.foods: Red meat prepared many ways - grilled, barbecued, roasted, slow cooked...
results.tasting:
Alluring aromas of ripe, dark blackberry and plum fruit integrate with well developed nutty, smoky oak.

The palate is simultaneously mouth filling and elegant with ripe fruit flavours and nutty oak interlaced with blackberry and chocolate leading to a dryer dark plum mid palate and lingering charry oak, firm tannin finish.  This expressive aged Cabernet, displays the fruit, intense palate and mouth filling tannin that makes this variety so desirable.

Cellaring:Although drinking well now expect this wine to evolve favourably well beyond 2020.

results.name: Shortland Fortified Shiraz
results.description: A full bodied palate of raspberry liquorice and Parma Violets. The spirit character is harmonious and integrated, and adds a refreshing lick of dryness to the finish.
results.foods: Friends, a fire and a cheese platter

results.name: Edwardo Fortified Semillon
results.description: An aperitif style of wine made by arresting the semillon ferment at a Beaume of 9 with pure alcohol. The wine is aged for six to twelve months in old oak and bottled as a vintage style. A complex wine best served chilled with a slice of lime. At 18% alcohol it is a great party starter.

results.name: Justine Merlot
results.description:
Night harvested grapes were destemmed and the must cold

soaked for three days after which a controlled fermentation

in open vats with pump over and plunging used to enhance the

quality. The wine was racked into French oak barrels for

malolactic fermentation and subsequent ageing. After 16 months the wine was bottled and stored before release.
results.foods: Perfect to enjoy with red meat such as roast lamb, kangaroo and other game. But no one will look away in disgust if you care to savour it with a good white meat or platter of fish
results.tasting:
The medium bodied, round in texture concentrated

sweet varietal fruit flavour is matched with

supportive spicy oak flavours and notes of cedar

and sweet sweaty leather. This is a complex wine

with refined mouth feel offering firm black/red currant fruit

results.name: James Cab/Merlot
results.description: Our Merlot block always seems to come through with the goods and in 2010 it was no exception it was a very hot dry season. The Cabernet reaped the benefits of the dry season being late to ripen. The machined picked grapes were crushed and destemmed then fermented in open vats and racked to barrel, the pressings going to our Basket press for gentle extraction. The wines were aged in new and old French oak for twelve months before blending. Traditional egg white fining was used prior to bottling using screw cap closures.
results.foods: Roasted rack of lamb, oven roasted duck, wild forest mushrooms and marinated eggplant.
results.award_1: Trophy Winner 2013 H.V. Boutique Wine Show
results.tasting:
Colour Medium red-purple

Aroma Dominated by fresh clean dark berry fruit supported by subtle oaky bouguet and hits of sweet tar

Palate Blackcurrant, cherries, savoury and lingering tannins, good lenght and mouth feel.

results.name: Tarantella Sangiovese Blend
results.description:
This multifaceted wine based on Sangiovese is aimed at reaching beyond the single varietal to produce a soft wine with a fresh mouth feel and lasting flavours. Adding to the complexity is a small amount of Shiraz, Cabernet and Merlot. 

The name Tarantella comes from a lively dance found in the southern Italian region of Puglia. Otherwise known as the “Spider Dance” or dance of the Tarantula, the dance involves spinning and stomping of feet in a wild frenzy, aimed at expelling the poison from the bite of a tarantula. 

Sangiovese with two years oak maturation dominates this wine with Cabernet, Merlot & Shiraz added to enhand the blend in the Super Tuscan manner.

The wine like the music and dance should be enjoyed to the full
results.foods: Enjoy with roast red meats such as lamb with lentils
results.tasting: Rich berry flavours with soft tannins and a long elegant finish

results.name: Rosato di Jupiter
results.description: Tintilla Rosato is made in a dryer style by leaving the freshly crushed juice on the skins for about 24 hours to extract the vibrant pink/red colour and the flavours without the harshness of prolonged contact. The juice is racked off and cool fermented in stainless steel retaining its fragrance, freshness and acidity.
results.foods: antipasto platter,  salads, pasta, ocean trout or paella and a variety of spicy Asian dishes
results.tasting: The red berry fruit flavour from the nose follows on to the palate with the strawberries and cherries added to with a touch of cranberry. The fine drying tannins balance the sweet fruits and residual sugar. 'The wine has brilliant cranberry flavours and dry Italian style finish.'

results.name: Spritzanti Lizzie Semillon
results.description: This wine was created to celebrate the wedding of winemaker James Lusby to Lizzie. It not only signifies the new family member but the new wave, more contemporary, younger generation of wine drinker. Made in a very modern style with restrained bubbles, more spritzig really, it is sweeter with complex flavours that can satisfy your thirst. It has a low alcohol level of 9%; offering an ideal introduction to wine and the art of food and wine matching.
results.foods: Perfect for welcoming your wedding guests or with cake when a sticky just won’t do.
results.tasting: This is an off-dry wine which has excellent structure with fruit (rock melon and passionfruit) softness on the palate and a crisp spritzig texture which gives balance to the slight sweetness.

results.name: STD + 6
results.description: Lifted & vibrant tropical fruit, honeydew melon & kiwi fruit with a touch of passionfruit.
results.foods: Thai salads, stir fries and mild curries
results.tagline: Attractive fresh tropical fruit and melon flavours held within a clear and natural acid backbone
results.tasting: Attractive fresh tropical fruit and melon flavours held within a clear and natural acid backbone which ensures a beautifully crisp and refreshing finish.

results.name: STD

Lifted aromas of kiwifruit and passionfruit with citrus, herb, nettle and floral blossom.

results.tasting: Ripe plum aromas and a soft fruit palate balanced by integrated oak and mature tannins provide a long soft finish rounding out a spectacular merlot

results.name: Laurence Sparkling Chardonnay Pinot Noir bottle
results.description: Hand picked grapes made in a traditional method champenoise style and matured on lees in single bottles for a minimum of two years.
results.foods: Perfect accompaniment for natural pacific oysters.
results.tasting: A powerful style with the base wine undergoing only a primary fermentation. Layers of bready yeast autolysis and toasty age. The mature fruit flavours balance the soft acidity to produce a sparkling wine in the top tier of sparkling wines in Australia.

results.name: Cuttaway Pinot Noir bottle
results.description: A new vintage release of our classic cool climate pinot noir still one of the best value pinot noirs available.
results.foods: Roast pork stuffed with chestnuts and sage in a  red wine jus
results.tasting: A perfumed nose of berry, plum and spicy oak compliments this firm fruit structured pinot noir that has great length and cellaring potential and a rewarding partner to those game dishes enjoyed at a fireside table

results.name: Cuttaway Pinot Gris bottle
results.description: Our classic French Alsace style Pinot Gris
results.foods: Pumpkin ravioli with burnt butter and sage sauce
results.tasting: A brilliant bronze colour with crisp pear, fig and floral characters complimented by a rich bodied palate producing a classic full bodied Pinot Gris to match a soft cheese and fruit platter after an intimate dinner with a loved one

results.name: Cuttaway Chardonnay bottle
results.description: New vintage release of our internationally acclaimed Chardonnay. Classic cool climate finesse and grace in a bottle.
results.foods: Freshly cooked pacific king prawns with a lime  and dill mayonnaise dressing
results.tasting: A delicate blend of ripe fruit and subtle oak characters with a complex peach and melon palate and outstanding length resulting in a multi award winning chardonnay that will match any chicken or pork dish with white wine and cream sauce

results.name: Angullong 'The Castle' Chardonnay
results.description: Vibrant stonefruit and citrus rind flavours with well balanced, integrated oak maturation. It has a lovely silky texture with complex cool climate complexity, natural acidity and a lingering finish.
results.foods: Elegant and complex, suiting a range of dishes.
results.tasting: Straw coloured with a slight green hue. Elegant and complex aromas of varietal peach stonefruit balanced with subtle oak complexity.

results.name: Angullong 'The Pretender' Savagnin
results.description: Vibrant & fresh lime citrus flavours with attractive spiciness. The cool climate acidity holds the textural & fleshy ripe fruit. The varietal, persistent flavours finish crisp & dry.
results.foods: Aperitif, Asian influence dishes, chicken salads.
results.tasting: Pale straw with a slight green hue.Complex aromas of fresh cut pear, citrus, nuts and marzipan with a subtle herbaceousness.

results.tasting: Dark ruby with a youthful purple hue. Complex aromas of fragrant dark berries within a context of tar, herbs and spice.
